title: Getting Started with buoyant
text: plumber2 adheres _server.yml standard following go example engine developers wish support . plumber2 currently defines 3 fields addition engine field: routes: array R files folders contain server logic annotated functions objects. constructor: path single R file constructs Plumber2 object. options: list options use server. corresponds options can seen ?plumber2::all_opts(). plumber2 provide function (create_server_yml()) creates file user can confident formatted correctly. generally good idea also provides place document content file. launch_server() function quite simple plumber2 since api() constructor understands _server.yml files input. function looks like : {.r launch_server} function(settings, host = NULL, port = NULL, ...) {   pa <- api(settings)   (!.null(host)) {     pa$host <- host   }   (!.null(port)) {     pa$port <- port   }   api_run(pa) } <environment: namespace:plumber2>
